alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Kenton; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 24 at 6:49PM EDT until July 24 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Kenton County in northern Kentucky... Southern Campbell County in northern Kentucky... Northern Pendleton County in northern Kentucky... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 648 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Butler, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Butler, Mount Auburn, Kincaid Lake State Park, Peach Grove, Catawba, Greenwood, Gene Snyder Airport and Lenoxburg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
